Class PlayerComputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayerComputer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Client, Server
    public abstract class PlayerComputer
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract parent class for the Server and Client. Provides methods to perform actions and update the game state. Has methods to modify the GUI game window.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected Game gameWindow
      The GUI game window.
      protected boolean isPlaying
      Boolean value determining whether the game is currently running.
      protected java.lang.String name
      Name of this player.
      protected java.util.List<Player> players
      List of all players.
      static int PORT
      The port to use.
      static int WIN_POINTS
      Number of points you need to win the game.

        Starts the game.

      • stopGame

        public void stopGame()
        Stops the game with synchronization.

      • slapCard

        public abstract void slapCard()
        Simulates a player slapping a card.

      • slapCard

        public void slapCard​(java.lang.String player)
        Overloaded version of slapCard for Server class.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who slapped the card.

      • updatePoints

        public void updatePoints​(java.lang.String player,
                         int diff)
        Updates the score of a given player with synchronization.
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose score to update.
        diff - how much the score changed by, positive for add points and negative for subtract.

      • dealCard

        public abstract void dealCard()
        Simulates a new card being dealt. Randomly generates a new card from the current player's deck.

      • drawCard

        public void drawCard​(Card card)
        Displays a card on the GUI game window.
        Parameters:
        card - the card to draw.

      • getMatch

        public Player getMatch​(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the player with a given name from the current object's list of players, or null if player not found.
        Parameters:
        name - player name to search for, or null if not found.

      • getSelf

        public Player getSelf()
        Returns this person's player object.
        Returns:
        this person's player object.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Returns a list of all players.
        Returns:
        a list of all players.

      • setPlayers

        public void setPlayers​(java.util.List<Player> players)
        For client class only, sets the local players list to the given list.
        Parameters:
        players - a list of players.
